summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2012/07/22 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Genéa Gaudet', 'Adam Hirsch'], 'Producers': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Christopher Poole', 'Bill Hayes', 'Jen Stocks', 'Kirk Streb', 'Mary Wilcher', 'Maggie Kay', 'Deanie Wilcher'], 'Studio': ['TLC']} Review Text: After watching all the seasons of Sisterwives, I feel I have come to love them and all that they stand for. I am "mainstream" LDS. It is against our beliefs to live this type of life because it is against the law. BUT, I have such respect for the Brown family and all that they stand for. They are true to the faith. I could never condemn or otherwise harrass these beautiful people. I believe in religious freedom and think the government needs to stay out of these peoples lives. They have wonderful relationships though they do have dissagreements as would any family. Those children are soooo loved and they know it. Cody is a great Dad and husband and if only more men were like him, what a better world this would be. Each and every one of these wives are amazing, kind and loving individuals. They just want peace for their family. God bless you Brown family and hang in there. I believe there will come a time when you will be allowed to practice your religion with no fear.

I relate your situation to the persecution of the first LDS people in the early days of the restoration of the gospel. I would love to meet you one day as I'm sure I would grow as a person, just from being in the presence of each and everyone of your delightful spirits. Hugs and love from an LDS woman. Review Title: Amazing way of life....in a good way Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/04 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Genéa Gaudet', 'Adam Hirsch'], 'Producers': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Christopher Poole', 'Bill Hayes', 'Jen Stocks', 'Kirk Streb', 'Mary Wilcher', 'Maggie Kay', 'Deanie Wilcher'], 'Studio': ['TLC']} Review Text: I am hooked on this darn show. I love watching these guys. Great kids and great parents. I can't wait until they get those houses built. Review Title: Great show Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Celebrity Wife Swap Review Date: 2013/04/04 Categories: Unscripted Product Description: ['Celebrity Wife Swap features the unlikeliest of moms swapping lives, including Splash contestant and Playmate Kendra Wilkinson and reality super mom Kate Gosselin of Kate Plus Eight fame.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Pamela Bower', 'Alex Cross', 'Bruce Toms', 'Jack Isacksen', 'Michael Davies', 'Tony Yates', 'Valerie Castillo', 'Ken Snow', 'Bailey Grizzle', 'Katie Bramble']} Review Text: Loved it! Two different worlds collide and it was very interesting to watch them handle the challenges. Love Kate and Kendra! Review Title: love Kendra Wilkenson and Kate Gosslin. What an interesting switch but I loved it. Seems like it will be a great show, I'm excited to watch the rest. Good job. Review Title: Great sow so far Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sister Wives Review Date: 2013/09/05 Categories: Unscripted, Drama Product Description: ["After a rough two years of living in rentals, Kody, his four wives and 17 children hope to soon move into their four adjacent homes. Tensions rise as the Browns struggle to find success in the wives' jewelry business, while the older children consider going to college out of state and the wives face difficult personal decisions."] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Genéa Gaudet', 'Adam Hirsch'], 'Producers': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Christopher Poole', 'Bill Hayes', 'Jen Stocks', 'Kirk Streb', 'Mary Wilcher', 'Maggie Kay', 'Deanie Wilcher']} Review Text: This program deals with very real issues. It is a great show and these people are to be commended for their dedication/commitment to their belief. Review Title: Very real Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/14 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Karl Kimbrough'], 'Producers': ['Erin Flinn'], 'Starring': ['Tori Spelling', 'Dean McDermott'], 'Studio': ['A&E Television Networks']} Review Text: How kind and difficult to put your life out there for others when you are in so much pain. I learned so much from this series, from Ms. Spellings reactions and processes of grief and healing to Mr. Mcdermotts behavior and handling of the process. Their open honest telling and living of this story is one that is helpful to all who will watch and listen. I am greatful for this and loved the series for what I was able to implement in my own life. Review Title: Very helpful and great learning process. Edwards'], 'Starring': ['Mike Vogel', 'Rachelle Lefevre', 'Alexander Koch'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: I love this show. The story line is so neat and the characters seem so real. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for unscripted television series that focus on family dynamics, personal growth, and relatable life challenges, often providing high ratings (averaging around 4.5 to 5.0). They appreciate shows that feature a positive portrayal of family values, complex relationships, and real-life issues, indicating a sentiment of empathy and respect towards diverse lifestyles, especially within alternative family structures.

Common themes in their selections revolve around familial ties, love, and personal struggle, with a notable enthusiasm for shows exploring unique lifestyle contrasts. Their viewing choices are frequently accompanied by supportive and positive commentary, underscoring a preference for heartwarming narratives that foster understanding and connection.

Quality-wise, they have shown a tendency towards productions from reputable studios and creators, favoring high production values and character-driven storytelling. However, there appears to be some price sensitivity, as revealed by a negative experience concerning perceived overcharging in their purchase interactions.

Overall, their core preferences reflect a desire for uplifting content that promotes family unity and respect for individuality, combined with a cautious approach to pricing and service expectations. This balance between emotional engagement and practical considerations shapes their overall shopping behavior.

target_interaction.title: touching movie, worth the purchase
target_interaction.text: Ok movie, touching but hard to watch if you've lost a child of any age.
description: Based on a true story, Return to Zero follows a successful couple, MINNIE DRIVER and PAUL ADELSTEIN, preparing for the arrival of their first child. Just weeks before their due date, they discover their son has died in the womb and will be stillborn. Lives and relationships forever altered by the loss, they try to cope, but nothing can save their marriage. That's when they discover that they're again pregnant and must come together to face a turbulent and terrifying pregnancy. Watch this powerful moving story unfold in this special DVD set including 14 behind-the-scenes videos, short films by the RTZ community and the original Kickstarter fundraising video.
target_interaction.store: Minnie Driver, Paul Adelstein, Alfred Molina, Connie Nielsen, Andrea Anders, Kathy Baker, Sarah Jones  (Actor),     Sean Hanish  (Director, Writer)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
